questions.questionText: What does HTML stand for?

Which element provides a machine-readable citation for a work?

Which attribute on media elements allows captions/subtitles to be provided?
Which element defines a shadow DOM insertion point for Web Components?

Which attribute on <a> mitigates reverse tabnabbing when opening new windows?
Which element allows embedding SVG content inline in HTML?
Which feature allows authors to hint to the browser to render a page in the background for faster navigation?
Which attribute on <form> allows specifying a submit target (e.g., iframe)?
Which element and attribute pair provides a semantic citation reference?
Which HTML mechanism helps to lazy-load images in supporting browsers?
Which attribute on media can require user gesture to play by default (browser policy)?
Which element is used to group a set of <option> elements together?
Which attribute on <input type='number'> sets the smallest valid value?
Which attribute prevents an element from receiving focus?
Which attribute provides a fallback download filename for <a download>?
Which attribute indicates that a form control is editable by the user?
Which element provides semantic grouping of navigation links for accessibility (ARIA landmarK)?
Which attribute instructs browsers to bypass CORS preflight for fonts/connections? (hint: early connection)
Which attribute enables a <form> control to be associated with a form not containing it?
Which element is used to provide fallback content for older browsers when embedding objects?
Which attribute on <button> sets the type to submit a form by default?
Which attribute on <link> tells the browser that the stylesheet should be used for printing only?
Which element is best used for marking up the main content of a page for accessibility?
Which element allows authors to include JavaScript templates that are inert until used?
Which attribute on <audio> or <video> allows showing native controls?
Which attribute on allows specifying an image placeholder before it loads (native lazy placeholder)?
Which element is used to declare page headers or footers within an article or section?
Which element can be used to mark an aside or tangential content?
Which HTML attribute is commonly used to enable inline accessibility labeling for ARIA-hidden elements?
Which element is used to create an ordered list where items are automatically generated numbers?
Which attribute on <script> optionally indicates that the script should be evaluated as a module and can use import/export?
Which attribute is used in a link tag to hint the browser to dns-prefetch an origin?
Which element is used to define a table header cell?
Which global attribute allows toggling visibility for printing and screen readers when combined with CSS?
Which attribute on a <link> or <script> instructs browsers to preserve integrity with SRI hashes?
Which attribute can be added to inline event handlers to reduce security risks and enable CSP wise approaches? (recommended: avoid inline handlers)
Which element provides keyboard input representation for user actions?
Which element represents output from a calculation or user action?
Which attribute on <button> or <input> can make a form control disabled and non-interactive?
Which attribute helps prevent automatic translation of content by the browser?
Which element is used to show a short label or keyword for a form control (often shown inside)?
Which element is intended for marking up keyboard shortcuts and user input (sample output)?
Which link rel value hints the browser to fetch a resource for future navigation?
Which HTML feature allows you to include microdata vocabularies for semantics (structured data)?

options.optionText: All of the above (depends on approach)

questions.questionText: What does the `zip()` function do?

options.optionText: Creates a list of tuples from multiple iterables

questions.questionText: How can you create an abstract base class?
What is the purpose of `*args` in a function definition?

options.optionText: To accept a variable number of non-keyword arguments

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of `**kwargs`?

options.optionText: To accept a variable number of keyword arguments
To accept a variable number of non-keyword arguments

questions.questionText: What is method resolution order (MRO)?

options.optionText: The order in which methods are called
The order in which Python searches for methods in a class hierarchy

questions.questionText: Which module would you use for unit testing?
What is a metaclass in Python?

options.optionText: A class that contains only static methods

questions.questionText: What does the `__init__.py` file signify in a directory?

options.optionText: It makes the directory a Python package
It is required for all Python files
